resources.string: You need to complete the previous level to continue
It\'s a perfect day to give you 5 points. Enjoy it!
Try again next time. Pay attention to the video to win a badge!
You have won the bagde of Level 1 and 30 points.
You have won the bagde of Level 2 and 30 points.
You have won the bagde of Level 3+ and 30 points.
You have won the bagde of Level 3 and 30 points.
You have won the bagde Off Before Sleep.
You have won the bagde Use Stairs.
You have won the bagde Empty Room.
You have won the bagde Team Play.
Do you really want to log out of KukuiCupBCN?
Do you really want to delete this player?
Do you really want to delete this team?
Do you really want to delete this tournament?
You have reached the maximum number of tournaments. Please delete one before creating another.
You must fill all the gaps
New password and confirmation must be the same
No tournament available at this moment. Please, contact Administrator.
Please enter your username and password!
Try activities of the next level! Reach 467 points to unlock all the activities again.
You have achieved the minimum points of the competition. Now you can do again all the activities!
Configure your computer and any external monitor to sleep after 20 minutes of inactivity. Once you have changed your settings, please take a photo showing the new settings for use in verification
Commit to using task lighting (like a desk lamp) instead of overhead room lights when possible. Press the Done! button when you make this saving action.
Show support for the Kukui Cup by Liking the Kukui Cup page on Facebook. Follow the link, click on the Like button, and then back on this page click the Done! button.

Calculate energy consumption for every appliance in your room. Write how many hours you use it every day. Then add up all appliances to know room consumption and take a photo for verification. Press the Done! button when you make this saving action.
During the day, turn off your room light and use daylight (if it\'s possible in your room). Press the Done! button when you make this saving action.
Write in a post-it the energetic consumption and hours of daily use of any domestic device. Then calculate his daily consumption, paste the post-it and take a photo for verification.
Take a look around and search for any device that uses LED bulbs and take a picture of it.
What time of the day do you do your laundry?
Kilowatt is cheaper if you do your laundry between 23h and 8h in the morning!
Kilowatt is cheaper if you do your laundry between 14h and 16h. Try to avoid doing it between 20h and 22h!
Kilowatt is more expensive between 20h and 22h. Try to avoid those hours!
When you do your laundry, how is the washing machine?
If your washing machine has low consumption, doing the laundry with full charge washing machine will save you some liters of water. But don\'t do it excessively full!
Is not advisable to do your laundry if there are not enough clothes. Wait until there are more to save water!
Did you turn off and unplug all electrical appliances before going to sleep?
Will you get the next challenge? Off and unplug all electrical devices in your room before going to sleep. Perform this action for 5 consecutive days to win the challenge.
Did you use the stairs today?
Will you get the next challenge? Use the stairs instead of using the elevator to win the challenge. Try this everyday to save more energy and feel more healthy!
Did you change any lightbulb for a LED?
Will you get the next challenge? Change any lightbulb for a LED to win the challenge.
Did you turn off and unplug all electrical devices in the empty rooms?
Will you get the next challenge? Off and unplug all electrical devices in any empty room. Perform this action for 5 consecutive days to win the challenge.
"Did your team find the correct appliance?

Will you get the next challenge? Team play! In this challenge, each team has to find the higher and lower consumption appliance. The first team to find them will be the challenge winner! 50 points for the team in second place.
Did you create a cool design? Take a photo of it!
Will you get the next challenge? Create a design to put on a shirt for the upcoming KukuiCupBCN and take a photo of it to win the challenge
This short educational video describes the difference between power and energy - a very important electrical concept that is used to determine what solar PV arrays can produce over time.
Work is being done only when a force is _____ an object.
When a moving object has the energy of motion it has this type of energy.
A: energy can be transferred from one object to another
B: temperature changes the type of energy
C: electrical energy can change light energy
This short video describes how the wind power works and what devices are used to produce electricity from it.
Through _____ electricity is obtained using the wind as source of energy
Where does the power of the electricity generated increase?
A: in the mills and electrical substations
B: in the electrical transformer of each mill
What energy chain transformation does the wind produce when moving the propellers of the mill?
B: kinetic energy -> mechanical energy -> electric power
C: mechanical energy -> electric power -> kinetic energy
This short video explains the benefits of LED lights and the difference with light bulbs.
In which country was the LED discovered?
What is the percentage of savings of LED lights?
B: none, it\’s better to use light bulbs
What\’s the difference between a LED bulb and a light bulb?
A: LED bulb pollutes more than light bulb
B: LED bulb doesn’t produce heat
This short video describes what resources we can use to produce renewable energy and their benefits
What resources can we use in the process of generating energy?
A: sun, water and earth heat
B: sun, wind and earth heat
C: sun, water, wind and earth heat
What are the benefits of renewable energies?
A: they are less clean than non-renewable energies
B: they can be renewed at the same rate as they are consumed
C: they contribute to global warming
What natural resource is, by now, the most used for the generation of electric energy?
This short video describes how the solar energy works and what devices are used to produce electricity from it.
A: a type of natural energy
B: a type of non-renewable energy
C: a type of energy generated by man
What are the benefits of solar energy?
B: non-renewable but does not pollute
C: does not pollute, renewable and is everywhere
What is the function of solar panels?
A: they are used to transform the wind into electrical energy
B: they are used to store the rays of the sun
C: they are used to generate electrical energy
